page.title: 01INTRODUCTION GENERAL VIEW
page.content: Until 1970 this land was farming and agricultural land. When the decision was taken to develop a new city, the land was purchased by Milton Keynes Development Corporation. Since 1970 the area has been developed towards a target of housing and employment for a quarter of a million people. The area contains council estates and owner occupier housing, privately developed. Each area has a small shopping complex, good roads, redways, schools, community and sports facilities. Existing villages were retained in the planning, providing a variety of environment. Existing hedgerows were retained, avenues of trees planted along the roads, roundabouts and verges were landscaped. The Grand Union Canal and the M1 motorway pass through. Willen Lake was developed for leisure.
